page.title: 14FARMING (PART 1)
page.content: NINE FARMS WERE SURVEYED. SIZES WERE FROM 24-210 ACRES. NUMBER OF WORKERS 2-5. 7 FARMS WERE OWNED BY FAMILIES, 2 BY COMPANIES. ALL THE FARMERS LIKED THEIR WORK- IN SPITE OF DISADVANTAGES. {DAIRY/BEEF SIZES OF HERDS BETWEEN 27 & 240 ANIMALS. COWS MILKED TWICE A DAY. EAT GRASS, HAY, SILAGE, CONCENTRATES, DAIRY CAKE. CALVES ARE BORN ALL YEAR,USUALLY SINGLY. ANIMALS ARE KEPT INSIDE IN WINTER. 60% GRASS IS MADE INTO SILAGE, 40% HAY {SHEEP} FLOCKS OF BETWEEN 38 & 165 ANIMALS. EAT GRASS, HAY, CONCENTRATES, OATS. LAMBS USUALLY BORN IN SPRING BUT SOMETIMES IN NOVEMBER/DECEMBER. SHEARING MAY/JUNE. WOOL TO WOOL MARKETING BOARD. DIPPING COMPULSORY- TWICE A YEAR.
